definition: the key trick/the secret of success
to demand/to request/to coerce
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)

sentences.english: If you have a flat-panel display ignore this tip.
sentences.chinese: 如果您有一个平板显示忽略这个要诀。

sentences.english: Tips on how to make Valentine's a Day a day for you and a special gal to remember.
sentences.chinese: 使情人节让你和某个特别的人难忘有要诀。

sentences.english: Practice is the key to any skill.
sentences.chinese: 实践是取得任何技能的要诀。

sentences.english: He attributes his success to diligence. "Undivided attention and good time management are the most important things."
sentences.chinese: 周锐认为，勤奋及善于分配时间是他获奖的要诀。

sentences.english: Self-trust is the first secret of success.
sentences.chinese: 自信是成功的第一要诀。

sentences.english: This is also the secret of success from many past great siddhas.
sentences.chinese: 这也是历代大成就者成功的要诀。

sentences.english: It provides the secrets of writing English news and a stylebook .
sentences.chinese: 它提供了写好英文新闻的要诀，及写作手册。

sentences.english: Diet and relaxation are two important keys to good health.
sentences.chinese: 限制饮食和放松身心是保持健康的两个要诀。

definition: secret/trick/knack/key
mnemonic chant/rhyme for remembering (arithmetic tables, character stroke order etc)
main point/essential
a trick/an ingenious method/know-how/the knack (of doing sth)
main aspects/essentials/gist
the one and only way/the only proper course to take
the essentials
secret know-how/key (to longevity)/secret (of happiness)/recipe (for success)
the Three Principles (in many contexts)
the gist (of a text or argument)/the main points
rare book/cheat code (video games)
skill/technique
eight methods of treatment (TCM)

16-character formula, esp. Mao Zedong's mantra on guerrilla warfare: 敵進我退，敵駐我擾，敵疲我打，敵退我追|敌进我退，敌驻我扰，敌疲我打，敌退我追[di2 jin4 wo3 tui4 , di2 zhu4 wo3 rao3 , di2 pi2 wo3 da3 , di2 tui4 wo3 zhui1] when the enemy advances we retreat; when the enemy makes camp we harass; when the enemy is exhausted we fight; and when the enemy retreats we pursue
to remember with reverence/to bear in mind/to keep in mind
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
